title: Behind Boozer, No. 3 Duke stuns No. 1 Michigan
content: Cameron Boozer scored 18 points, and the No. 3 Duke Blue Devils handed another neutral-site loss to fellow blueblood Michigan, knocking off the top-ranked Wolverines 68-63 on Saturday in a raucous possible Final Four preview in the nation's capital.

content: The Cowboys and free-agent-to-be running back Javonte Williams reached agreement on a three-year contract that includes $16 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Saturday.

content: Donovan Dent hit a layup at the buzzer in overtime to lift UCLA over No. 10 Illinois 95-94 on Saturday after the Bruins rallied from a 23-point deficit, the program's largest comeback since rallying from 19 down in a 2019 home victory over Oregon.

title: Top 50 USMNT players of 2026, ranked by club form: Which Americans made the top 10?
content: Who are the 50 best American players of 2026 so far? The top 10 sees a shake-up as the USMNT Player Performance Index returns.

title: PM Modi flags off India‚Äôs fastest metro and Namo Bharat RRTS ‚Äî routes, speed and benefits explained
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the Meerut Metro and Namo Bharat services in Uttar Pradesh, dedicating development works worth Rs 12,930 crore. The 82 km Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat Corridor, designed for speeds up to 180 kmph, enhances regional connectivity. The Meerut Metro, operating on the same infrastructure, is set to become India's fastest metro network.

title: Red Fort, temples on radar? 8 suspects with Bangladesh, Pak links held for plotting terror attack
content: Eight individuals with alleged links to Pakistan's ISI and Bangladesh-based extremist groups were apprehended in Tamil Nadu and West Bengal. Intelligence reports indicated a potential terror plot targeting Delhi's Red Fort and prominent temples. The arrests followed specific inputs about a module planning subversive activities, with digital materials being analyzed to uncover a wider network.

title: 'Mom, he will kill me today': Mother recalls chilling last call in Tripura teen assault case
content: A 19-year-old student from Tripura was allegedly confined, assaulted, and raped by her live-in partner in Gurugram. Her mother and lawyer claim she endured prolonged torture, including being burned and cut, with attempts on her life. Police are investigating the serious allegations.

title: Brother vs brother as Morne Morkel and Albie Morkel split loyalties in IND vs SA clash
content: Brothers Morne and Albie Morkel will face off as rival coaches in the T20 World Cup Super 8 clash between India and South Africa. Morne coaches India's bowling attack, while Albie serves as a consultant for South Africa, both aiming for victory despite their family ties. Their childhood backyard rivalries are now amplified on the international stage.

title: Sisters, aged 25 and 23, found dead a day before wedding in Jodhpur; no suicide note recovered
content: Two sisters, Shobha (25) and Vimla (23), were found dead at their Jodhpur home on Friday, just a day before their scheduled weddings.  They were rushed to a hospital around 4 am after their health suddenly deteriorated, but were declared dead on arrival. Preliminary investigations suggest poisoning, with the post-mortem report to confirm the exact cause.

title: Bill Gates' daughter always keeps one thing out of pitch deck for her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, is building her AI shopping startup Phia without leveraging her last name.  She recently secured $35 million for the company, which helps young women find deals by comparing prices across retail and resale sites. Gates is determined to prove Phia's independent success, despite her billionaire lineage.

title: IDFC First Bank reports Rs 590 crore fraud in Haryana government accounts
content: IDFC First Bank reported a Rs 590 crore discrepancy in Haryana government deposits at its Chandigarh branch, suspending four employees. The bank has initiated a forensic audit and is working with other banks to recover funds. This disclosure follows Haryana's directive for departments to close accounts with specific private lenders due to suspected financial irregularities.

title: RBI‚Äôs new data centre far from seismic risks and cross-border threats ‚Äî where is it?
content: The Reserve Bank of India has established a high-security data center in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, to protect critical financial systems. This strategic location minimizes exposure to cross-border threats and seismic risks, ensuring operational continuity. The facility supports core banking functions and enhances the safety and resilience of India's financial infrastructure.

title: ‚ÄòIndian talent is quite poor‚Äô: Anupam Mittal on India's tech transformation
content: Shark Tank judge Anupam Mittal highlighted the significant evolution of India's tech talent pool over two decades. He noted that skilled professionals, once scarce and difficult to hire, are now world-class and returning to India by choice. This shift is attributed to India's robust digital ecosystem and mature product culture, fostering inspiring work opportunities.

title: 'Abki baar Trump se haar': Congress targets Centre over Trump tariffs
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh attacked the Centre over the proposed India-US interim trade pact, calling it ‚ÄúAbki baar Trump se haar‚Äù and demanding it be put in cold storage and renegotiated. He warned agri import liberalisation would hurt farmers across states and questioned the deal‚Äôs timing amid US tariff turmoil after a Supreme Court ruling against Donald Trump‚Äôs earlier measures.

title: Ex-CIA agent claims US has decided on imminent strike against Iran
content: Former CIA officer John Kiriakou claimed the US has decided to launch military strikes on Iran within days, citing a source who visited the White House. He said internal divisions exist, with JD Vance and Tulsi Gabbard opposing action, while Marco Rubio backs it, as US forces reposition across the Middle East.

title: What is Anthropic's new AI tool that wiped off billions from cybersecurity stocks
content: Anthropic's new AI tool, Claude Code Security, scans for code vulnerabilities, prompting a multi-billion dollar stock market crash in the cybersecurity sector. While existing scanners use pattern matching, this AI reasons like a human researcher, identifying complex flaws. Despite its research preview status and human oversight requirement for fixes, the market reacted sharply to the potential disruption.

title: ‚ÄòWhy now?‚Äô: Gavaskar questions timing of Super 8 pre-seeding row at T20 World Cup
content: Fans are criticising the T20 World Cup's pre-seeding format, which placed strong group winners in the same Super 8 group. However, batting legend Sunil Gavaskar questioned the timing of this outrage, suggesting logistical complexities for the ICC in a multi-country tournament. He highlighted international travel and accommodation as potential reasons for advance group assignments.

title: ‚ÄòProblem lies in‚Ä¶‚Äô: Irfan Pathan reveals how Abhishek Sharma can break free from slump
content: Former all-rounder Irfan Pathan has advised T20 World Cup opener Abhishek Sharma to adjust his shot selection against off-spinners, urging him to settle in before attacking. Pathan highlighted Abhishek's tendency to play across the wicket too early. He also praised Ishan Kishan's current form but cautioned about his approach against wide deliveries.

title: Matthew Tkachuk denies ‚Äòpsychological warfare‚Äô claims vs Sidney Crosby
content: Matthew Tkachuk made it clear Team USA will not rely on mind games against Sidney Crosby ahead of the Olympic gold medal clash with Canada. Instead, the Americans are leaning on discipline, depth, and belief after a strong semifinal win. With Crosby‚Äôs status uncertain and Canada still dangerous, the final will test Team USA‚Äôs composure and championship readiness.

title: Who is Pernille D√∏svik? Inside Johannes Kl√¶bo‚Äôs fianc√©e and love story
content: Johannes H√∏sflot Kl√¶bo is one of the biggest stars in winter sports. The Norwegian cross-country skier has dominated the Olympics and World Cup circuit for years. Off the snow, his personal life has also drawn attention. Kl√¶bo is engaged to Pernille D√∏svik, a young professional from Trondheim. The couple confirmed their engagement in June 2025 after several years together. Fans often see her supporting him during competitions and training periods.

title: Connor McDavid and wife Lauren Kyle McDavid combined net worth 2026
content: The success of the professional career of Connor McDavid and his wife, Lauren Kyle McDavid, is reflected in the financial empire they have created. Whether it is McDavid and his lucrative Edmonton Oilers contract and endorsement book or the growing design and hospitality businesses of Lauren, the two have a combined net worth in 2026 that can be seen as a wise investment, brand strength and long-term excellence on and off the ice.

title: AI push, tribute to Jayalalithaa: Key takeaways from PM Modi‚Äôs 131st Mann Ki Baat address
content: Prime Minister Modi, in his Mann Ki Baat address, highlighted AI's role in animal healthcare and agriculture, showcasing innovations at the AI Impact Summit. He also remembered Jayalalithaa, urged embracing Indian culture over foreign influences, and cautioned against digital fraud, emphasizing the importance of local products and organ donation.

title: Sohail Khan visits father Salim Khan at Lilavati hospital ‚Äî watch
content: Sohail Khan visited father Salim Khan at Lilavati Hospital amid his minor brain haemorrhage and ventilator support since Feb 17. Paparazzi caught him leaving with security. Family upset over media leaks; celebs like Ranveer Singh, Aamir Khan visited.

title: Who is Shikhar Dhawan's wife Sophie Shine? Their love story, wedding, and his net worth
content: Cricket star Shikhar Dhawan, after retiring from international play, married his girlfriend Sophie Shine on February 21, 2026, in an intimate Delhi-NCR ceremony. The couple, who met in Dubai and made their relationship Instagram official in May 2025, celebrated their union with friends and family. This marks a new, happier chapter for Dhawan following his divorce.

title: ‚ÄòShe‚Äôs a vegetarian, I‚Äôm not‚Äô: JD Vance reveals ‚Äòbest and worst‚Äô dish he cooked for wife Usha
content: US Vice-President JD Vance humorously recounted his early culinary struggles, admitting his first attempt at cooking for his wife, Usha, was "inedible." While his initial vegetarian dish failed spectacularly, Vance has since mastered baking, with brioche and Japanese milk bread now among his best creations. The couple, married since 2010, are expecting their fourth child.

title: Mohd Amir defends Abhishek Sharma ‚Äòslogger‚Äô jibe, repeats India won‚Äôt reach semis
content: Former Pakistan bowler Mohammad Amir reignited controversy at the T20 World Cup with a renewed attack on India's Abhishek Sharma, questioning his defensive technique. Amir also reiterated his prediction that India will not reach the semi-finals, citing stronger performances from teams like South Africa and the West Indies.

title: ‚ÄòVery touched‚Äô: Lula reacts after Portuguese songs played during lunch with PM Modi
content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva was touched by India's musical tribute during his state visit, recalling a similar gesture he made for PM Modi in Brazil. The visit saw both leaders aiming to boost bilateral trade to $20 billion in five years and signing agreements on rare earth minerals, digital partnership, and mining cooperation.

title: 'Set private parts on fire': Tripura teen brutally assaulted by live-in partner in Gurgaon
content: A 19-year-old university student in Gurgaon has accused her live-in partner of horrific violence, including pouring sanitiser on her private parts and attempting to set them ablaze. The man allegedly subjected her to brutal assaults, filmed compromising videos, and threatened her ability to walk or have children. Police have registered an FIR and are investigating the case.

title: US envoy sparks row by claiming Israel has a right to much of Middle East
content: Pakistan and thirteen other nations have strongly condemned US Ambassador Mike Huckabee's remarks endorsing Israel's biblical claim to Arab lands. The joint statement, issued by foreign ministers and regional bodies, denounced the comments as a violation of international law and a threat to regional stability.

title: T20 World Cup: How Tilak Varma's form is correlated with Abhishek Sharma
content: India's T20 World Cup campaign has seen batting trump cards Abhishek Sharma and Tilak Varma struggle, with their form appearing correlated. Captain Suryakumar Yadav acknowledged Varma's struggles but expressed confidence, while highlighting the team's strategy to allow batters to play their natural game when possible. The team management is backing the duo, aiming to replicate their previous success.

title: Trump's tariffs struck down, what's next? Here's what SBI suggests
content: The US Supreme Court's decision to strike down President Trump's tariff framework has introduced a new dynamic.  While this lifts policy uncertainty, countries must now navigate a "counter-intuitive" negotiation period.  The executive branch has swiftly implemented a temporary 10% global import tariff using a different trade act, with Congress holding the ultimate power to extend it.

title: Selection headache or perfect balance? Shastri flags India‚Äôs dilemma ahead of Super 8s
content: India's unbeaten run in the T20 World Cup highlights their formidable depth, a strength that also presents their sole selection dilemma. Former coach Ravi Shastri believes the winning combination will likely remain intact against South Africa, emphasising flexibility and the need for extra bowling options, especially with dew a factor.

title: Delhi on high alert: Hawk-eye on vehicles entering city after intel warns of strikes
content: Security agencies have heightened vigilance in Delhi following intelligence of a potential LeT terror plot targeting religious and heritage sites, including a Chandni Chowk temple. This alert follows a previous blast near the same temple. Paramilitary forces are deployed, vehicles are being inspected, and CCTV surveillance is intensified. Local stakeholders and various establishments are also undergoing verification.

title: 'Bombed our civilian compatriots': 'Dozens' killed after Pakistan conducts airstrikes in Afghanistan
content: Afghanistan reported dozens killed and wounded after Pakistan conducted airstrikes in eastern border provinces, targeting alleged militant camps. Pakistan stated the strikes were in response to recent suicide attacks, including one by an Afghan national. Tensions escalate as Pakistan warns of further action if Afghan soil is used for terrorism.

title: T20 World Cup | Focus squarely on India's batting but bowling is the real deal
content: While India's batting line-up has dominated the pre-T20 World Cup discussions, the potent bowling unit has quietly become the team's real strength.  Bowlers like Varun Chakravarthy and Arshdeep Singh, alongside the consistent brilliance of Jasprit Bumrah, provide crucial confidence and have been instrumental in securing victories, proving they are the key to defending their title.

title: Karnataka BJP MLA Chandru Lamani caught taking Rs 5 lakh bribe
content: Chandru Lamani, BJP MLA from Shirahatti in Gadag, was caught by Lokayukta police allegedly accepting a Rs 5 lakh bribe during a raid at his Balaji Hospital in Laxmeshwar. Acting on contractor Vijay Pujar‚Äôs complaint over an 11% commission demand, police detained Lamani and his aides, who allegedly tried to dispose of cash.

title: Watch: Footage captures devastation after Pakistani strikes on Afghan madrassa
content: Pakistani air strikes targeted seven militant camps in Afghanistan, including a religious madrassa. Islamabad stated the operations were in response to recent suicide bombings within Pakistan, blaming militants operating from Afghan soil. Kabul condemned the strikes, accusing Pakistani generals of deflecting from their own security failures. Relations between the two neighbours have deteriorated sharply since the Taliban returned to power in 2021.

title: New glitch hits Moon mission: Why did Nasa delay Artemis II again
content: NASA's Artemis II mission faces a delay as engineers discovered an issue with helium flow in the rocket's propulsion stage. This fault necessitates rolling the rocket back to the Vehicle Assembly Building for repairs, pushing back the planned March launch. The problem echoes a similar glitch during the Artemis I mission, prompting a thorough investigation into potential causes.

title: Incensed Trump raises tariffs from 10% to 15% causing more trade turmoil
content: President Trump escalated global tariffs to 15% following a Supreme Court rebuff, citing Section 122 of the Trade Act to address balance-of-payments deficits. This move, driven by pique, is expected to disrupt global trade and faces potential legal challenges due to inconsistent trade balances with various nations.

title: T20 WC: Pre-seeding, venue comfort leave India, SA with no excuses in Super 8s
content: As the T20 World Cup enters the Super 8s, last edition's finalists India and South Africa prepare for a crucial clash in Ahmedabad. Both teams, having faced scares in the group stage, now face immense pressure with little room for error. Familiarity with the venue and opponents is high, but the mental game will be key.

title: Bride's pet dog sparks violent clash in UP, wedding cancelled
content: A wedding in Fatehpur turned violent after a pet dog's barking led to a brawl between the bride's and groom's families. The disturbance during rituals escalated when the groom's side allegedly attacked the animal, resulting in a physical fight. At least five people were injured, and the ceremony was called off. No formal complaint has been lodged yet.

title: 57-year-old kidnapped Sikh man found dead in US
content: Avtar Singh, a 57-year-old cook at a California gurdwara, has been found dead after being kidnapped. Surveillance footage showed him being forced into a white SUV by three unidentified individuals. Singh had previously served at the Damdami Taksal headquarters.

title: 'Used Global Event For Dirty Politics': PM Modi Slams Congress' Shirtless Protest
content: A group of Youth Congress workers on Friday barged into a hall at the AI Summit, shirtless, shouting slogans against the government over agreeing to a trade deal with the US.

title: LPG Explodes During Op To Control Fire At Delhi Home, Cops Among 13 Injured
content: An LPG cylinder exploded while fire and police personnel were trying to douse a house fire in northwest Delhi's Majlis Park on Sunday, leaving 13 injured, officials said.

title: Sabarimala Tantri's Bail Raises Questions: Did Investigation Lose Direction?
content: The Tantri was arrested by the Special Investigation Team probing alleged irregularities related to gold-plated encasings at the temple.

title: "Serious Lack Of Judgement": Academics On Youth Congress' AI Summit Protest
content: More than a hundred prominent academics from universities and research institutions across the country have issued a strongly worded joint statement, criticising the Indian Youth Congress protest at the India AI Impact Summit

title: 5 Live Cartridges Seized From IIT Bombay Hostel, Bihar Link Under Probe
content: Five live 7.65 mm cartridges were recovered from the bag of a student at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay in Powai during a security check inside the hostel premises, following a minor dispute over money between students

title: Indian Navy Intercepts Iranian Boat Off Gujarat, Seizes Rs 5 Crore Cigarettes
content: The Indian Coast Guard has intercepted a foreign boat in the Arabian Sea off Gujarat and apprehended four Iranian nationals after seizing 200 cartons of foreign brand cigarettes valued nearly Rs 5 crore, the ICG said on Sunday.

title: Why Hasn't US Made Arrests Over Epstein Links? UK Did With Ex-Prince Andrew
content: The stunning arrest of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor by UK police on suspicion of misconduct in public office must have chilled many powerful American men to the bone. They may now wonder: could something like this now happen in the US?

title: India, US Postpone Trade Deal Meet Amid Trump's Tariff Setback: Report
content: India and Washington have decided to reschedule the official meeting over the interim bilateral trade agreement, so that both sides can factor in the implications of the US Supreme Court judgment striking down the Trump administration's tariff hikes

title: What Is Section 122, The Law Trump Used To Raise Global Tariffs To 15%
content: Trump turned to Section 122 as a new legal basis so that broad tariff increases can stay in place while his administration works on more permanent trade measures.

title: 1 Terrorist Killed In Big Op In J&K's Kishtwar, Encounter Underway
content: A terrorist was killed in an ongoing operation by security forces in a remote area in Kishtwar district of Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday, officials said.

title: Cop Killed, 24 Injured As Homemade Bombs Explode In Ukraine's Lviv
content: The police said that the first explosion occurred after a patrol crew arrived at the suspected scene of a shop break-in, while the second explosion occurred a little later.

title: "Nobody's Fault": Kerala Couple Pardons Driver After 22-Month-Old Son Killed In UAE Crash
content: Before returning to India, the child's parents submitted a written statement to authorities saying they did not wish to pursue legal action against the driver, who is also an Indian expatriate.

title: Rajya Sabha, Council Polls Spark Tussle In Maharashtra Opposition Camp
content: The upcoming elections to the Rajya Sabha and the Maharashtra legislative council have triggered frenetic activity in the Opposition camp and sparked buzz of a tussle between the Shiv Sena (UBT), the Congress and the NCP (SP)

title: Dating Match, Live-In, Then Brutal Abuse: Tripura Teen's Gurugram Horror
content: A dating match, a live-in relationship, suspicion and then horrifying torture -- a 19-year-old from Tripura, who came to Gurugram to study, is under treatment at a Delhi hospital and her live-in partner, Shivam from Delhi, has been arrested

title: "Robotic Soldiers Would Be Coming In Future": Ex-DRDO Chief To NDTV
content: Artificial intelligence is no longer a futuristic promise confined to laboratories and science fiction. It is rapidly becoming the backbone of modern defence systems, reshaping how wars are prepared for, fought, and ultimately deterred.

title: Lashkar-Linked Terror Module Busted, 8 Arrested For Plotting Attack In India
content: The police recovered dozens of eight mobile phones and 16 SIM cards from the suspects, officials said.

title: Jodhpur Sisters, Aged 25 And 23, Die By Suicide On Their Wedding Day
content: A household which was preparing for the wedding festivities of their two daughters was plunged into sadness when the sisters died the same day in Jodhpur's Manai village, with officials saying both women allegedly consumed a poisonous substance.

title: "AI Summit Turning Point For How World Will Use AI": PM Modi In Mann Ki Baat
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday hailed the recently concluded AI Impact Summit held in New Delhi's Bharat Mandapam and said that through this, the world witnessed "Bharat's remarkable capabilities" in the field of artificial intelligence.

title: Have F1‚Äôs regulations for 2026 made the sport too complicated?
content: f1's new generation of cars haven't completed a competitive lap yet . four-time world champion Max Verstappen likened them to all-electric series formula E "on steroids" a week into the first official preseason test this month . the criticism has extended beyond the two title rivals .

title: With Mike Evans declining retirement, where do he and the Bucs stand?
content: he will return in 2026 . he suffered three broken vertebrae in his neck during a preseason game . the Bucs' all-time leading scorer was enduring one of the lowest and loneliest points of his life .

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S.' first-ever mass start medal, women's freeski halfpipe final postponed
content: The penultimate day at the Olympics felt like the calm before the storm. After Team USA women's ice hockey won gold against Canada in a thrilling match on Thursday, the American men followed up by advancing to the gold medal match by defeating Slovakia on Friday. They'll have a day off before facing Canada in the gold medal match Sunday, the last event of the 2026 Winter Olympics before the closing ceremony. That's not to say there was nothing happening on Saturday. Team USA women's curling fell short in a bronze medal match against Canada, and Mia Manganello won a bronze medal in the mass start, the U.S.'s first medal in that event. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Follow live with the best events from Saturday below.

title: X factors, key players to watch and picks for USA-Canada
content: the top-seeded team from canada will take on the no. 2 seed united states of America (8:10 a.m. ET) it has all come down to one game for ultimate glory in the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament . the winner gets Olympic bragging rights for the next four years .
